# MAD Design Group Plugin Marketplace

Internal Claude plugins for the MAD Design Group team.

## Available Plugins

| Plugin | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **MAD SEO** | SEO research, blog outline generation, article drafting, and meta tag optimisation |
| **MAD Translation** | Hygraph CMS translation workflows with brand glossary enforcement |
| **MAD Support** | Customer support response drafting for product enquiries and troubleshooting, warranty claims, order tracking, spare parts, e-NRG fuel delays, and Intercom conversation triage |

---

## Installation Guide

### Step 1: Open the Plugins Menu

Click the **+** button at the bottom of the chat, then select **Plugins** → **Add plugin**.

![Step 1 - Open Plugins](docs/screenshots/step-1-open-plugins.png)

---

### Step 2: Add Marketplace from GitHub

In the Browse plugins panel, click the dropdown and select **"Add marketplace from GitHub"**.

![Step 2 - Add Marketplace](docs/screenshots/step-2-add-marketplace.png)

---

### Step 3: Enter Repository URL

Paste the following URL:

```
https://github.com/MAD-Design-Group/mad-claude-plugin
```

Click **Sync** to add the marketplace.

![Step 3 - Enter URL](docs/screenshots/step-3-enter-url.png)

> ⚠️ **Important:** Do **not** include `.git` at the end of the URL, or it will fail:

![Error Example](docs/screenshots/step-4-error-example.png)

---

### Step 4: Install the Plugin

Once the marketplace is added, you'll see **MAD Design Group** in the dropdown. Select it and click **Install** on the desired plugin (MAD SEO, MAD Translation, or MAD Support).

---

## Verifying Installation

After installation, verify the plugin is working by:

1. Starting a new conversation in Claude Desktop
2. Typing a command like `translate status`
3. Claude should recognise the skill and respond accordingly

---

## Troubleshooting

### "Failed to add marketplace" Error

- Ensure the URL does **not** end with `.git`
- Check that the repository is public or you have access
- Verify your internet connection

### Plugin Not Appearing

- Try clicking **Sync** on the marketplace to refresh
- Restart Claude Desktop
- Check that the plugin structure is valid in the repository

---

## For Developers

### Marketplace Structure

```
mad-claude-plugin/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── marketplace.json          ← Marketplace manifest
└── plugins/
    ├── mad-seo/
    │   ├── .claude-plugin/
    │   │   └── plugin.json       ← Plugin manifest
    │   └── skills/
    │       ├── seo-blog-outline/
    │       ├── seo-blog-draft/
    │       └── seo-meta-tags/
    ├── mad-translation/
    │   ├── .claude-plugin/
    │   │   └── plugin.json       ← Plugin manifest
    │   └── skills/
    │       ├── hygraph-translator/
    │       ├── hygraph-translator-v2/
    │       ├── hygraph-translator-v3/
    │       └── translation-sample/
    └── mad-support/
        ├── .claude-plugin/
        │   └── plugin.json       ← Plugin manifest
        └── skills/
            ├── product-enquiry/
            ├── warranty-claim/
            ├── order-status/
            ├── spare-parts/
            ├── nrg-delays/
            └── intercom-triage/
```

### Adding New Plugins

1. Create a new folder under `plugins/`
2. Add `.claude-plugin/plugin.json` with plugin metadata
3. Add your skills under `skills/`
4. Update `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json` to include the new plugin
5. Push changes to GitHub

---

## Support

Having issues? Contact the team or raise an issue in the repository.

# mad-seo

SEO content pipeline for MAD Design brands with agent/subagent architecture. Five specialised agents handle a Hygraph-driven workflow: fetch from CMS, research the web, write content, review quality, and publish back to CMS.

## Installation

Install via the Claude Code plugin marketplace:

```
/install mad-design-group-skills:mad-seo
```

### MCP Requirements

This plugin requires two MCP servers configured at the workspace level:

- **Hygraph MCP** -- used by hygraph-fetcher and hygraph-publisher agents for CMS read/write
- **Firecrawl MCP** -- used by web-fetcher agent for SERP analysis and page scraping

## Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/seo-meta-tags` | Analyse and optimise meta tags with SERP competitor analysis. Fetches ContentSeo entries from Hygraph, generates recommendations, and writes selected tags back to CMS. |
| `/seo-blog-outline` | Generate SEO-optimised blog post outlines through competitive research and content gap analysis. Fetches PageBlog entries from Hygraph. |
| `/seo-blog-draft` | Transform blog outlines into publish-ready articles with E-E-A-T citations. Fetches outlines from Hygraph, runs source research, applies humaniser pass, and writes draft back to CMS. |
| `/faq-answers` | Generate FAQ answers optimised for AEO/GEO, featured snippets, and voice search. Supports batch processing with two-wave parallel dispatch. |

## Architecture

### Pipeline Pattern

All content types follow the same Hygraph-driven flow:

```
Fetch (Hygraph) --> Research (web) --> Write (copyrighter) --> Review (reviewer) --> Publish (Hygraph)
```

The main Claude session orchestrates the pipeline. There is no separate orchestrator agent.

### Agents

| Agent | Model | MCP Access | Role |
|-------|-------|------------|------|
| hygraph-fetcher | sonnet | Hygraph (read) | Schema discovery, content extraction |
| web-fetcher | sonnet | Firecrawl | SERP analysis, competitor research, live pages |
| copyrighter | opus | None | Professional SEO content creation |
| reviewer | sonnet | None | Brand voice and SEO quality review |
| hygraph-publisher | sonnet | Hygraph (write) | Safe CMS write-back |

### Internal Skills

Seven internal skills are preloaded into agents to provide domain expertise:

| Skill | Preloaded By | Purpose |
|-------|-------------|---------|
| hygraph-fetcher | hygraph-fetcher agent | CMS query patterns |
| web-fetcher | web-fetcher agent | Web research methodology |
| copyrighter | copyrighter agent | Writing methodology and templates |
| reviewer | reviewer agent | Quality review dimensions |
| hygraph-publisher | hygraph-publisher agent | Safe CMS mutation patterns |
| seo-expertise | copyrighter agent | SEO/GEO/AEO knowledge base |
| copywriting-expertise | copyrighter agent | Professional copywriting techniques |

## Safety

A `PreToolUse` hook intercepts `mcp__Hygraph__update_entry` calls to verify only expected SEO fields are being updated, preventing unintended CMS mutations.
